meanings.definition: Not bending or yielding; firm and resolute.
meanings.sent1: Her unbowing determination led her to overcome every obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent2: The oak tree stood unbowing in the face of the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: Despite the teasing from her classmates, she remained unbowing in her decision to pursue her passion for painting.
meanings.sent4: His unbowing spirit was like a mighty fortress, impervious to doubt or fear.
meanings.sent5: The unbowing mountain peak seemed to touch the sky with its unwavering height.

meanings.definition: Not willing to submit or give in; stubborn.
meanings.sent1: The unbowing child refused to eat his vegetables no matter what.
meanings.sent2: His unbowing refusal to compromise made negotiations difficult.
meanings.sent3: The unbowing goat stubbornly stood on the rock, refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: Her unbowing loyalty to her friends was unwavering, even in tough times.
meanings.sent5: The unbowing mule refused to budge an inch, no matter how much it was urged.

meanings.definition: Showing no signs of bending or flexibility.
meanings.sent1: The unbowing metal rod remained straight even under heavy pressure.
meanings.sent2: The unbowing ruler did not bend when pressed against the table.
meanings.sent3: The unbowing tree branch refused to sway in the wind, standing stiff and unmoving.
meanings.sent4: His unbowing stance on the issue left no room for negotiation or compromise.
meanings.sent5: The unbowing iron gate blocked the path with its unwavering rigidity.
